title: How a Friend Helped Write a Famous Book
summary: Jojo Moyes is a writer who almost stopped writing her book called Me Before You. She felt sad because her books were not selling well. Her friend Sophie Kinsella, who was also a writer, told her to keep going. Sophie said, 'You have to write this book.' Jojo listened and finished the story. The book became very popular and was made into a movie. It is about a girl named Louisa who takes care of a man named Will who cannot move after an accident. Sophie Kinsella died recently, but Jojo remembers her as a kind friend who helped her succeed.

background_read: This article is about how friends can help each other achieve big things. Jojo Moyes was a writer who felt discouraged because her books were not selling well. With encouragement from her friend Sophie Kinsella, she finished a book that became a bestseller and a movie. It shows the importance of support and perseverance in creative work.
Article_Structure: WHO: Jojo Moyes, a writer, and her friend Sophie Kinsella, another writer.
WHAT: Jojo almost stopped writing her book Me Before You, but Sophie encouraged her to finish it, leading to its success as a bestseller and movie.
WHERE: This happened in their personal lives, discussed on a radio show called Desert Island Discs.
WHY: To show how friendship and encouragement can help people overcome challenges and achieve their goals.

perspectives.description: Sophie Kinsella's encouragement helped Jojo Moyes complete her book, highlighting the value of friends in creative pursuits.
